title: Claudine Resting

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Carter H. Harrison
publication_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of Carter H. Harrison, exh. cat. (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1929), n.p., cat. 15, as Claudine

Ulrich Thieme and Felix Becker, Allgemeines Lexikon der Bildenden Künstler 26 (Leipzig: E. A. Seemann, 1932), p. 267.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Century of Progress Exhibition, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1933), p. 79, cat. 704, as Claudine Resting, c. 1926–7.

C. J. Bulliet, Art Masterpieces in a Century of Progress Fine Arts Exhibition at The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: North-Mariano Press, 1933), n.p., pl. 105, as Claudine Resting, n.d.

Frederick A. Sweet, “Carter H. Harrison as a Collector,” Bulletin of The Art Institute of Chicago XXXVIII:5 (September–October 1944), p. 79 (ill.), as Claudine Resting, n.d.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in the Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1961), p. 350, as Claudine Resting, 1923.

Alfred Werner, Pascin (New York: Harry N. Abrams, 1962), n.p. (ill.), as Claudine Resting, c. 1923.

El Mundo de los Museos, The Art Institute of Chicago (Madrid: Editorial Codex, S.A., 1967), pp. 13 and 67, fig. 46. 

Gaston Diehl, Pascin (New York: Crown, 1968), p. 17 (ill.).

Nakayama Mikio, Grand Collection of World Art: Modigliani and the School of Paris 24 (Tokyo: Kodansha, 1975), p. 137, pl. 43.

A. James Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth Century European Painting (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1980), p. 61, no. 3C3.

Yves Hemin, Guy Krohg, Klaus Perls, and Abel Rambert, Pascin: Catalogue Raisonné 1 (Paris: Editions Abel Rambert, 1984), p. 66, no. 85 (ill.), as Claudine au repos, 1913.

Takeda Atsushi hen, Pasukin (Tky: Iwasaki, 1995), p. 202, no. 32 (ill.), as Claudine Resting, 1923.
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Exhibition of Paintings from the Collection of Carter H. Harrison, July 18–Oct. 14, 1929, cat. 15, as Claudine

The Art Institute of Chicago, Century of Progress Exhibition, June 1–November 1, 1933, p. 79, cat. 704, as Claudine Resting, c. 1926–7.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Contemporary French Paintings from the Carter H. Harrison Collection, December 1935–January 1936, no cat.
provenance_text: Mr. and Mrs. Carter H. Harrison (1860–1953), Chicago, by 1933 [Chicago 1933]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1936.
